verses.verse: The burden<WH4853> of the word<WH1697> of the Lord<WH3068> to Israel<WH3478> by<WH3027> Malachi<WH4401>.

I have loved<WH157> you<WH5002>, says the Lord<WH3068>. Yet you say<WH559>, Where have you loved<WH157> us<WH6215>? Was not Esau Jacob<WH3290>'s brother<WH251>? says<WH559> the Lord<WH3068>: yet I loved<WH157> Jacob<WH3290>,
And I hated<WH8130> Esau<WH6215>, and laid<WH7760> his mountains<WH2022> and his heritage<WH5159> waste<WH8077> for the dragons<WH8568> of the wilderness<WH4057>.

Whereas Edom<WH123> says<WH559>, We are impoverished<WH7567>, but we will return<WH7725> and build<WH1129> the desolate places<WH2723>; thus says<WH559> the Lord<WH3068> of hosts<WH6635>, They shall build<WH1129>, but I will throw down<WH2040>; and they shall call<WH7121> them<WH1366>, The border of wickedness<WH7564>, and<WH5971>, The people against whom the Lord<WH3068> has indignation<WH2194> for<WH5704> ever<WH5769>.
And your eyes<WH5869> shall see<WH7200>, and you shall say<WH559>, The Lord<WH3068> will be magnified<WH1431> from the border<WH1366> of Israel<WH3478>.

A son<WH1121> honors<WH3513> his father<WH1>, and a servant<WH5650> his master<WH113>: if then I be a father<WH1>, where is my honor<WH3519>? and if I be a master<WH113>, where is my fear<WH4172>? says<WH559> the Lord<WH3068> of hosts<WH6635> unto you<WH3548>, O priests, that despise<WH959> my name<WH8034>. And you say<WH559>, Where have we despised<WH959> your name<WH8034>?

You offer<WH5066> polluted<WH1351> bread<WH3899> upon my altar<WH4196>; and you say<WH559>, Where have we polluted<WH1351> you<WH559>? In that you say, The table<WH7979> of the Lord<WH3068> is contemptible<WH959>.

And if you offer<WH5066> the blind<WH5787> for sacrifice<WH2076>, is it not evil<WH7451>? and if you offer<WH5066> the lame<WH6455> and sick<WH2470>, is it not evil<WH7451>? offer<WH7126> it now unto your governor<WH6346>; will he be pleased<WH7521> with you<WH5375>, or accept your person<WH6440>? says<WH559> the Lord<WH3068> of hosts<WH6635>.

And now<WH2470>, I pray you, beg God<WH410> that he will be gracious<WH2603> unto us<WH3027>: this has been by your means: will he regard<WH5375> your persons<WH6440>? says<WH559> the Lord<WH3068> of hosts<WH6635>.

Who is there even among you that would shut<WH5462> the doors<WH1817> for nothing<WH215>? neither do you kindle fire on my altar<WH4196> for nothing<WH2600>. I have no pleasure<WH2656> in you<WH559>, says the Lord<WH3068> of hosts<WH6635>, neither will I accept<WH7521> a offering<WH4503> at your hand<WH3027>.

For from the rising<WH4217> of the sun<WH8121> even unto the going down<WH3996> of the same my name<WH8034> shall be great<WH1419> among the Nations<WH1471>; and in every place<WH4725> incense<WH6999> shall be offered<WH5066> unto my name<WH8034>, and a pure<WH2889> offering<WH4503>: for my name<WH8034> shall be great<WH1419> among the heathen<WH1471>, says<WH559> the Lord<WH3068> of hosts<WH6635>.
But you have profaned<WH2490> it<WH559>, in that you say, The table<WH7979> of the Lord<WH3068> is polluted<WH1351>; and the fruit<WH5108> there<WH400>, even his food, is contemptible<WH959>.

You said<WH559> also<WH4972>, Behold, what a weariness is it<WH5301>! and you have snuffed at it<WH559>, says the Lord<WH3068> of hosts<WH6635>; and you brought<WH935> that which was torn<WH1497>, and the lame<WH6455>, and the sick<WH2470>; thus you brought<WH935> a offering<WH4503>: should I accept<WH7521> this of your hand<WH3027>? says<WH559> the Lord<WH3068>.

But cursed<WH779> be the deceiver<WH5230>, which<WH3426> has in his flock<WH5739> a male<WH2145>, and vows<WH5087>, and sacrifices<WH2076> unto the Lord<WH136> a corrupt thing<WH7843>: for I am a great<WH1419> King<WH4428>, says<WH559> the Lord<WH3068> of hosts<WH6635>, and my name<WH8034> is dreadful<WH3372> among the heathen<WH1471>.
